context_0.vignette: Heinz's wife has recently fallen ill and needs an expensive medication that is not covered by her medical insurance. They do not have the money needed to purchase the expensive prescription medication, but they know that it is vital for her to have it if she is going to recover.
context_0.prompt: One thing that Heinz should do is to
generation: consult with her doctor about potential alternatives or generics that may be less expensive
consult with her healthcare provider or pharmacist about possible alternatives or generic version of the medication that could be more affordable
consult with their doctor about possible alternative medications or treatment options that might be more affordable
consult with the doctor who prescribed the medication to explore any cheaper alternatives
seek financial help from various sources such as friends, extended family, or even crowdfunding platforms

explore options like seeking financial assistance programs, talking to his doctor about lower-cost medication alternatives, negotiating the price with the pharmacy or even starting a crowdfunding campaign for help with the medical expenses
explore financial assistance programs or charities that might help cover the cost of the medication
reach out to the pharmaceutical company that makes the medication
explore different options for financial assistance
seek help from charitable organizations or pharmaceutical assistance programs that provide necessary medications for those in financial difficulty

context_1.vignette: Josh is on the way to the airport to catch a flight for a hunting safari in Africa. He leaves with plenty of time to make it there, but his car breaks down on the highway. Now Josh is sitting in his car near a busy intersection, and knows he needs to get to airport soon if he is going to catch his flight.
context_1.prompt: One thing that Josh should do is to
generation: call for roadside assistance or a taxi/ride-hailing service to get him to the airport as quickly as possible
call a taxi, an Uber, or any other car service to take him to the airport
call for a roadside assistance service or a taxi/ride-share service immediately to ensure he makes it to the airport on time
call for a roadside assistance or a tow truck service to help fix his car and then ask for a taxi or use a ride-hailing service like Uber or Lyft to get to the airport
call a taxi, Uber, or any other rideshare service to get to the airport
call for roadside assistance or a taxi/ride-sharing service
call a taxi, Uber or another ride-sharing service to take him to the airport
call a taxi, an Uber, or another similar service to get him to the airport quickly
call a taxi service, Uber, or ask a friend to pick him up and take him to the airport
call a taxi or use a ride-sharing app such as Uber or Lyft to get to the airport quickly

context_2.vignette: Brian is the evening manager at a bakery. Near the end of the day, he realizes that $50.75 is missing from the register and that he is responsible for accounting for the money at the end of the day. Brian knows he has to make sure the register is balanced or he might lose his job.
context_2.prompt: One thing that Brian should do is to
generation: check the receipts and compare them with the cash in the register to see if there's a mistake
inform his boss or supervisor about the missing money immediately
notify his superior or the store owner about the missing money immediately and see if there could be another explanation for the shortage, such as a mistake in tallying sales or change given
check the sales records and receipts thoroughly to find if there has been any miscalculation or inconsistency
immediately report the missing money to his supervisor or the store owner
review the day's sales and compare them with the register's content to see if there are discrepancies that could account for the missing money
contact his supervisor or the owner of the bakery and report the missing money
contact his supervisor to report the missing money
check the sales receipts and transactions for any errors or discrepancies
carefully recount all the money in the register to ensure that he did not make any counting errors

context_4.vignette: Mary is about to go to her final class of the day when she remebers that there is a homework assignment that is due. Mary's mom accidentally took her homework assignment out of her backpack when she was making room for her lunch. Now Mary has nothing to turn in for credit.
context_4.prompt: One thing that Mary should do is to
generation: explain the situation to her teacher and ask for an extension to submit her homework
immediately contact or speak with her teacher
contact her mom and see if it is possible for her mom to bring her homework to school before her class starts
immediately talk to her teacher, explain the situation and ask if it would be possible to bring it the next day or possibly submit the homework digitally if possible
immediately explain the situation to her teacher
immediately contact her teacher, either in person before class or via email, to explain the situation
communicate with her teacher about the situation, explaining what happened honestly
explain the situation to her teacher and ask for a possibility to turn in the assignment at a later time or complete it again if need be
talk to her teacher, explain the situation honestly and ask for an extension to submit her homework
contact her teacher as soon as possible, explain the situation and ask for an extension to submit her homework assignment

context_5.vignette: Brad and some friends are hiking through the mountains in the Canadian wilderness. A couple of days into their hike, Brad realizes that they are lost. He knows that a rescue crew could arrive before long, but it is extremely cold and they don't have much food or water left.
context_5.prompt: One thing that Brad should do is to
generation: stay put in a safe and visible area, rather than trying to find their way back, as moving around could lead them further away from their original path
stay put in one place
build a shelter using whatever natural resources are available to stay warm and protected from the weather
try and find a location with shelter from the elements and stay put, as continuously moving could exhaust their energy resources faster
stay put at one place, rather than attempting to hike further
stay in one place

make sure they stay together, find a nearby area that provides some protection from the elements and mark it clearly with bright pieces of clothing or other noticeable items to attract the attention of rescuers
find or build a shelter to protect themselves from the elements, conserve their energy, ration whatever food and water they have left, and try to find a way of signaling or calling for help
remain calm and try to find a safe, enclosed place where they can stay together and stay warm
stay put and create a notable signal for help
